deck: Lake Michigan is one of the five Great Lakes of North America and the only one located entirely within the United States. It is the second largest of the Great Lakes by volume and the third largest by surface area, after Lake Superior and Lake Huron. It is bounded, from west to east, by the U.S. states of Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, and Michigan. The word "Michigan" originally referred to the lake itself, and is believed to come from the Ojibwa word "mishigami" meaning "great water".

deck: The future Africa in the world of Judge Dredd and the Mega-Cities.
description:
Pan-Africa features in the 2000ad and Megazine world of Judge Dredd.

Dozens of Governments control sections of the great continent, under wildly different philosophies and beliefs - capitalism, Islam, lawless enclaves, free trading zones, development areas.

In an effort to ease this evolution, the Pan-African Compromise was reached, allowing free travel and trade between many of these areas, with a Pan-African Judge force created to prevent crimes such as ivory poaching from the animal reserves.

But many of these states do not recognise the authority of these Judges who roam the continent, placing the lawkeepers in constant danger of attack.
name: Pan-Africa

deck: Eldfur is one of many undersea colonies dotting the ocean floor. Once the site of a thriving civilization, the colony fell into ruin due to repeated attacks by a sea serpent, known as "The Bugala".
description:
Located within a valley on the ocean floor, the village of Eldfur was once the home to a peaceful and rather advanced civilization. Then, the Bugala came. Possibly following some migratory trail, the oceanic leviathan returned to Eldfur once each year, leaving devastation and despair in it's wake. Each year the Eldfur army would repel the Bugala, always suffering heavy casualties. With less populace to tend to the fields or repair the village's infrastructure, Eldfur fell into ruin. The valley's once lush vegetation died off.

The King of Eldfur once instructed the last few remaining warriors, in Eldfur's army, to enlist the aid of a champion, one who might end the threat of the Bugala, once and for all. A raiding party abducted the young aquatic hero, Aqualad, for this purpose. Though Aqualad showed his combat mettle, against the greatest warrior Eldfur still possessed, the youth proved a poor match for the Bugala. Only through the intervention and assistance of his mentor, Aquaman, was Aqualad able to even survive his battle with the Bugala, let alone drive it off. Though grateful, the men of Eldfur knew the Bugala would return the next year. It is unknown if the Eldfur colony survived the following year's encounter with the Bugala. No further mention has been made of the colony, nor the few remaining colonists. Their likely fate is a grim one.

The Eldfur are biped humanoids. Unlike Atlanteans, or the Maarzon tribesman, the Eldfur, in appearance, are decidedly more ichthyic. Hairless, their bodies are covered in violet scales, with a ridged fin running down the center of their skulls. Like Atlantis, the government system of Eldfur is a monarchy.
name: Eldfur

deck: Wundagore II is a planet in the Marvel universe that was home to The New Men.
description:
Origin

Wundagore II is the planet where The High Evolutionary and his New Men are sent to live in peace away from Earth by Thor (Thor #135, December 1966). Wundagore II appears in Tales To Astonish (#94-#96, August-October 1967) when The Hulk finds himself captured by The High Evolutionary, who plans to use him to destroy the rebel uprising of The Knights of Wundagore.

Creation

Wundagore II was created by Stan Lee.

History

The High Evolutionary had created a new race by speeding up the evolutionary process of animals by thousands of years. These creatures were called The New Men. Both creator and creations were sent to live in Wundagore II by Thor in the story "The Maddening Menace of the Super-Beast". In Wundagore II peace reigned and The High Evolutionary was the supreme overlord until his experimental creations turned against him and decided to take over the planet themselves. This story arc from Tales To Astonish concludes by all The New Men reverting back to their original animal forms and The High Evolutionary evolving into man's ultimate evolution. The new being returns The Hulk to Earth before ceasing to exist himself, thus leaving Wundagore II inhabited only by feral animals,

deck: A hell on earth city that makes Gotham look like Springfield.
description:
OVERVIEW

A fictional city where Eddy Current escapes to after fleeing Dum Dum Asylum and, possibly the setting of Metropol.

Chad is established as a veritable Gomorrah of modern times, where the most wretched and human of society co-exist amongst the squalor of a completely urbane setting. It has been said that a city can be without pity, whereas Chad is portrayed as a city without hope.

deck: Asia is the world's largest and most populous continent. It appears as a location in several comics across numerous publishers.
description:
Asia covers 8.7% of the Earth's total surface area (or 30% of its land area) and is located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres. It hosts 60% of the world's current human population.

Dependencies and special administrative regions:

deck: A planet in the Saga galaxy prized for its gunpowder fields. It houses a detention center the war fugitives Alana & Marko first met and is the birth planet of their daughter, Hazel.
description:
History

The Robot Kingdom and their Coalition Forces from the planet Landfall have waged war with The Narrative from Landfall's only moon named Wreath. The two sides have agreed to cease fighting there, so they have outsourced their age old war to many foreign lands to include the ancient planet of Cleave orbiting a faded old star.

Geography

Most of the planet Cleave is still uncharted by the Coalition Forces or the Narrative. Of the charted areas, the planet does not have much to offer except for the predominantly Coalition Forces controlled gunpowder fields. Marko, however, obtained a map from a grease monkey with previously thought unexplored areas. Key terrain features are River Tranquility, Sentinel Falls, Lava Swamps, a desert, Murder Valley, The Uncanny Bridge, the fort & mountain and Rocketship Forest.

Folklore

After dark, it is said that the Horrors come out. They were originally thought to be imaginary monsters, but a scout from Marko's platoon saw one first hand. The scout reported "it had glowing red eyes and teeth like a thousand needles" and that it devoured a dozen men.
name: Cleave

deck: A maze, beneath or somewhere near Gotham city, in which the Court of Owls puts people to death.
description:
The maze has been used by the Court of Owls to put people to death for what appears to be as long as the court itself has existed. Its walls are made of 'construction' marble. Notable features of the maze include:

  • a room full of wooden coffins.
  • a giant statue of a owl made of white marble that sits above a fountain.
  • various rooms containing models of Gotham throughout the ages.
  • rooms full of photos of people to have died in a maze, along with a camera.

When the Court of Owls attacked Batman, and put him in the maze, he survived for 8 days with no supplies. Although he drank the water from the owl fountain, he believed it to be drugged. He eventually escaped by summoning what little strength he had left to beat the Talon in hand to hand combat before using the Potassium Chloride from the camera to create an explosion. The members of the Court of Owls watched Batman from above while he was in the maze, referring to him as a 'gladiator'. The maze is built above a large underground river.

deck: The Valley of Spirits is a fabled location in China where The Mandarin discovered The Ten Rings of Power.
description:
Origin

The Valley of Spirits is a mythical valley in China. Stories of it's dreaded nature have spread far and wide across the land thus making it an almost forbidden place to venture.

Creation

The Valley of Spirits was created by Stan Lee and Don Heck.

History

A young Mandarin, who had recently lost possession of his estate to the Communist government, headed into The Valley of Spirits not heeding the warnings of local peasants. In the valley he was attracted to a mysterious, unnatural glow. Fearlessly he descended into the valley, believing the Gods themselves were guiding his footsteps. On the way he came across the remains of a dragon and startled by the discovery, he stumbled and fell down a mountainside. Upon landing he discovered the remains of an ancient alien ship. The Mandarin entered the vessel and discovered a log left by it's pilot. There he remained until he had learnt all the secrets of the many worlds it's pilot, Axonn-Karr had traveled.

Knowledge was not the only thing Mandarin had gained within the spaceship. He also discovered the source of its limitless power - ten gems contained in rings that held power like nothing seen before on Earth.

In Other Media

The Valley of Spirits also appears in the action-RPG video game Marvel Ultimate Alliance as the location of Mandarin.You can also unlock Doctor Strange as a playable character after you find him there.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: The Origin Of The Mandarin!; Break-Out in Cell Block 10!

deck: The sweet, cynical City of Cynosure where all dimensions meet eventually.
description:
Creation

Cynosure was created in an issue of Warp. It was originally suppose to be destroyed in the story line, but John Ostrander, who sat in on the plotting of the book, argued against it. Cynosure became the center of the First Comics multi-verse and the setting for Ostrander’s book Grimjack

Nature

Cynosure is located at the center of the multi-verse. Different dimensions phase in and out of Cynosure allowing travel between universes. The ease of transport between dimensions caused Cynosure to become a center of commerce. It is possible to go from one dimension to another by simply walking across a street. This can cause difficulties since the rules of reality can change with each dimension. The laws of physics may be different. Technology might work in one dimension while magic in another.

Because not all dimensions are permanently connected to Cynosure, one runs the risk of being trapped in a dimension when one phases out. Not all dimensions are habitable by all life forms. Also, many areas like the Pit are so crime ridden that they are dangerous to outsiders.

Government

Council of Ministers

For most of it's history, Cynosure was lead by a Council of Ministers. The council was made up of appointed members of the city's aristocrats. Elections were held only for minor bureaucratic positions. The most noted member of the Council was Lord William Honesworth, who was perhaps the only honest member. The Council's job was to oversee trade in Cynosure. No corporation could be shown favoritism for fear a trade war would break out. However, much of the Council was corrupted by the Alpha Centauri Commercial Empire. When this was found out, rival corporations assassinated most of the Council and a trade war broke out. After the Trade Wars, a council consisting of representatives of various corporations was created by Lord Honesworth.

The Trans-dimensional Police

The TDP was the law enforcement division of the government. Grimjack was at one time a member partnered with Roscoe Schumacher. Grimjack left under a bad cloud. One branch of the TDP was the Shadow Cops who worked deep undercover and were a rival to Cadre.

Cadre

Cadre was a covert agency in Cynosure. It's mission was to protect the city from all threats. Any method was acceptable including bribery, blackmail, and assassination. The leader of the organization was Mayfair who recruited Grimjack after he left the TDP. The organization was originally based out of Mayfair's house and included only several agents. Eventually, the organization grew as did Mayfair's ambitions. This caused Grimjack to leave the organization.

Lord Protector

The Lord Protector was an artificial being constructed from cells and energies of all the dimensions. He had vast reality warping powers. The Lord Protector of Grimjack's time was Phaeton. They did not get along.

deck: Hospital station specialising in cataloguing and investigating alien medical phenomena.
description:
Written by John Tomlinson, Mercy Heights ran for two series in the British comic 2000ad:

  • Series one (15 episodes) progs 1033-1047
  • Dead of Winter (one episode) prog 1124
  • Series two (15 episodes) progs 1133-1148

Mercy Heights is an experimental facility charged with investigating and cataloguing alien medical phenomena. It is also a hospital station catering for patients of all shapes, sizes and planetary origins. It's staff are dedicated to preserving life whatever the cost.

Staff include:

  • Administrator Sehetu - Chief of Staff
  • Commissioner Rostau - Sehetu's superior on Earth
  • Vandra Lorius - psychic member of the medical team
  • Stig Lydecker - member of the medical team
  • Lydia Rostau - member of the medical team
  • Lilla Ferro - member of the medical team
  • Tor Cyan - member of the medical team
name: Mercy Heights

deck: Mid-World is part of the world that Roland Deschain inhabits. It is also the only world from which it is possible to enter the Dark Tower. Arthur Eld once united all of Mid-World under his rule and it was known for a time as the Kingdom of All-World.
description:
Brief History

Mid-World is generally divided up into three sections: In-World, Mid-World, and End-World. It is the geographic center of All-World.

Before the world "moved on", In-World was the center of civilization. Mid-World (the section) contains such lands as the Waste Lands. The line between Mid-World and End-World is formed by the arc of the Callas. End-World is the location of the Dark Tower itself. It is also noted there is an oil refinery somewhere here.
name: Mid-World

deck: Highly complex imaginary dimension created by Quentin Quire to trap the minds of Wolverine and Armor
description:
Imaginary construction cobbled together from bits and pieces of Quentin´s favorite video games and movies, it was created as a psychic prison which Quentin has total control over. Using his telepathic powers he managed to trap Wolverine and Armor to fulfill his vengance against Headmaster Wolverine for make him part of the Jean Grey´s School. The bodies of Wolverine and Armor were left behind hidden in the real world but Wolverine´s body enter in a Berserker state in which his body act for itself to find Quentin and kill him.

Providing the Construct with AI and dealing with his normal life Quentin did not realize that he was losing the control of the place. Hidding of Wolverine´s body quentin decided to enter to the construct and recover the control over the dimension. Insted he was trapped inside dealing with thounsands of men conforming an imaginary army that was seeking kill the three of them.

The only option left to the grupo in order to escape was to kill Quentin´s representation in that reality, so Wolverine stabbed him in the chest realesing them from their prison. Wolverine asked Quentin to train him in Psychwar and avoid any future confrontation.

deck: The City of Mutants is the secret home of the Cult of Mesmero, followers of Magneto.
description:
Origin

The City of Mutants is the underground lair of the Cult of Mesmero. It is hidden in an undisclosed dessert in the US. The city has the capability to rise to the surface and is advanced far beyond human technology. Mesmero's cult are followers of Magneto and use the technologies in the city to awaken latent mutant abilities.

Creation

The City of Mutants was created by Arnold Drake and Jim Steranko.

Major Story Arc

Lorna Dane and Iceman were kidnapped by Mesmero's cult and taken to The City of Mutants. The cult were aware Lorna was Magneto's daughter and wanted to awaken her latent mutant powers so she could join her father in his quest to rule mankind. The X-Men came to rescue the pair but Lorna's abilities were already activated. Lorna chose to aid the X-Men in their battle against the cult but chose to stay with her father once he was defeated.
name: City of Mutants

deck: Paradise is an island in the North Atlantic, home of the Ani-Mates
description:
An island that was previously ruled by the Ani-Mator, who was working for the group known as The Right, experimenting on Ani-Mates to create hybrid Ani-Mates, such as Bird-Brain.

During the Fall of the Mutants story arc, the New Mutants along with Bird Brain paid a visit to Paradise, where they were captured by the Ani-Mator. It was here that Cypher was shot and killed by the Ani-Mator as he pushed Wolfsbane out of the way, taking a bullet for her.

Much later after Cypher was brought back in Necrosha, Cypher had troubles coming to term with his resurrection, which prompted the team to go visit Paradise, giving Cypher some closure.
name: Paradise

deck: Horz was the capital city of the Orovar Empire on the planet Barsoom. A great scientific community dwelt there 100,000 years before John Carter arrived on Barsoom.

deck: An alien world in the galactic hub and the setting for 2000AD story - Tales of Telguuth.
description:
Tales of Telguuth - a series of one-off tales, all based on the fantasy world of Telguuth.

Written by Steve Moore and illustrated by a variety of British artists. The first series of tales used the same 'one episode with a twist' format as other 2000AD regulars - Future Shocks, Pulp Sci-Fi, Terror Tales, Time Twisters and Vector 13.

Later stories would take on more ambitious multi-episode epics.
name: Telguuth

deck: Cord Castle is a medieval castle and former laboratory of mad scientist Drexel Cord, now run by his daughter Janice.
description:
Origin

Cord Castle was imported brick by brick from Europe by Dr. Drexel Cord, a business competitor of millionaire inventor Tony Stark. The castle doubled up as Cord's lab and was the location where he created The Demolisher and met his tragic death while trying to save his daughter Janice from his own creation. Janice was eventually rescued by Iron Man and S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent Jasper Sitwell. After her father's death, Janice hired attorney Vincent Sandhurst to oversee the sale of the property to Stark Industries.

Creation

Cord Castle was created by writer Archie Goodwin and artist Johnny Craig in 1968.
name: Cord Castle

deck: "The Cape" is the military base in Florida where Captain Marvel initially worked under the guise of Walter Lawson.
description:
Origin

Missile guidance expert Walter Lawson was on his way to his new job at The Cape when he was accidentally killed by Colonel Yon-Rogg of The Kree Intergalactic Army. His identity was taken by Captain Mar-Vell who took his place at The Cape in order to study Earth's advances in missile development.

Creation

The Cape was created by Stan Lee, Roy Thomas and Gene Colan.

History

Other notable employees at The Cape were General Bridges, Carol Danvers and Norman Lundquist.

The Cape has come under attack from a number of threats including Sentry #459, SOLAM, Quasimodo and Super Skrull.

Similarly to Cape Citadel which appears in X-Men, The Cape is based on Cape Canavral.

Other Media

In the animated series Spider-Man Unlimited, The Cape appears in episode 1 as the military base where John Jameson's rocket is launched to Counter Earth. Spider-Man later high-jacks another rocket from The Cape in order to rescue the missing astronaut.

deck: City in Saudi Arabia
description: The Holiest City in the religion of Islam. The site of the Ka'aba, a cuboid temple that is the holiest site in the religion of Islam and the location to which every Muslim must make a pilgrimage at least once in their lifetime. Mecca is the birthplace of the prophet Mohammed and is the city in which he composed the Koran.
